author: Sanjith Sidhardhan
title: M Padmakumar’s Jalam is a woman-centric movie
text:
Director M Padmakumar has two films coming up this year.
While his first film Kanal boasts of a star cast led by Mohanlal, the second movie Jalam has a women-centric plot with Priyanka Nair in the central role.
Its scribe Suresh Babu says that the film tells the story of a family who is "promised land by the government but doesn't receive it due to the red tape involved."
The serious content of the film runs the risk of not finding any takers as far the exhibitors are concerned as movies such as Siddharth Siva's widely-acclaimed Ain was only screened in a handful of theatres across the state. About this scenario, Suresh says, "Jalam might have a serious subject but it focuses on reality. Also it's a commercial movie, which has elements that would appeal to people."
The scribe, who also penned Kanal, says the post-production work for the Mohanlal film is complete. Meanwhile Padmakumar is busy with the pre-production of a legal thriller, scripted by Anoop Menon.
